summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unspecified recipient, regarding the provision of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the delivery of a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery productions, including replacements for files she had been unable to review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, to whom discovery materials (laptop, hard drive, CD) are being provided for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working for the Southern District of New York, coordinating the delivery of discovery materials to Maxwell.

connections.description: Prosecutor providing discovery materials to the defendant as part of the legal process.

events.title: Delivery of Discovery Materials to Maxwell
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney drops off a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery productions for Ghislaine Maxwell to review, including replacements for previously unviewable files.

events.title: Prior Discovery Production Sent
events.description: A hard drive containing a separate discovery production, including replacements for numerous files, was sent via FedEx to Maxwell the prior week.

keyFacts: Discovery materials, including a laptop, hard drive, and CD, were physically delivered to Ghislaine Maxwell on November 18, 2020, for her review.
The production included replacements for numerous files from prior productions that Maxwell had been unable to review.
A separate hard drive production was sent via FedEx the prior week (around November 9, 2020).
The correspondence is from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing pre-trial legal proceedings.
The email requests confirmation that the delivered drive has been provided to Maxwell.
